title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 January 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:47 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:22 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:23 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:24 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:29 <npm> has quit  
04:29 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <rrodriguez> has quit  
07:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <vmassol> good morning, there seems to be a problem on xwiki.org with the jira macro: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
08:21 <vmassol> hmmm and http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News doesn't display the AS anymore....  
08:24 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <vmassol> didn't help  
08:26 <vmassol> mflorea: gm, are you doing the RC1 release?  
08:26 <+mflorea> today?  
08:26 <vmassol> what' the date?  
08:26 <vmassol> release date I mean  
08:26 <vmassol> I think you forgot to update it on xwiki.org  
08:27 <vmassol> (I remember you sent a vote to postpone it right?)  
08:27 <+mflorea> I was going to send a vote for this thursday, 19  
08:27 <vmassol> (don't recall the dates)  
08:27 <vmassol> antoher vote?  
08:27 <+mflorea> it was thomas  
08:27 <+mflorea> not me  
08:27 <vmassol> ok, what was the date?  
08:27 <vmassol> (for RC1)  
08:27 <+mflorea> in the past :) let me check  
08:28 <+mflorea> 12 January  
08:28 <vmassol> we cannot release today?  
08:29 <vmassol> 12!!  
08:29 <vmassol> which was already 1 week after the planned date  
08:29 <vmassol> wow  
08:29 <vmassol> we're really bad  
08:29 <+mflorea> what's the point of releasing today? it's almost like renaming M1 in RC1  
08:29 <vmassol> and?  
08:29 <vmassol> what' wrong with that?  
08:30 <vmassol> that's not how it works marius  
08:30 <vmassol> we're not trying to stuff things  
08:30 <vmassol> we're supposed to do time boxing  
08:30 <vmassol> the onyl reason NOT to release  
08:30 <vmassol> is because of a blocking issue  
08:30 <vmassol> so the question is: how many of blocking issues do we have?  
08:31 <vmassol> BTW  
08:31 <vmassol> and RC is supposed to not have anything  
08:31 <+mflorea> sure, but cannot ignore the fact that we has holidays and no so much activity, so planning releases around those dates was not a good idea,  
08:31 <vmassol> and?  
08:31 <vmassol> I really don't get it  
08:31 <vmassol> it's not about maount of work  
08:31 <vmassol> it's not about holidays  
08:31 <vmassol> it's about time boxing  
08:31 <+mflorea> I'm not surprised it got postponed  
08:31 <vmassol> it has nothing at all to do with amount of work  
08:31 <vmassol> absolutely nothing  
08:31 <vmassol> actually it's the opposite  
08:32 <vmassol> the less people the easier it is to release  
08:32 <vmassol> because there are less things and thus less chance to break thinfs  
08:32 <vmassol> things  
08:33 <+mflorea> doing releases is not a goal in itself, I know we do timeboxing, but we should have something to timebox.  
08:33 <vmassol> it is  
08:33 <vmassol> it's THE goal in itself  
08:33 <vmassol> and we do have things  
08:35 <+mflorea> ok, I'll send a mail to see what the rest thing. if they agree to release today, I'll do it.  
08:35 <vmassol> you cannot do timeboxing and feature-based releases at the same time, they are opposite  
08:35 <vmassol> what we need to know  
08:35 <vmassol> is what are the blockers today  
08:35 <vmassol> I remmeber seeing thomas and denis talking about a big issues last friday  
08:36 <vmassol> then we have failing tests that we need to fix too  
08:36 <vmassol> IMO we should aim to fix the blocking + tests today  
08:36 <vmassol> to be able to release tomorrow  
09:08 <+tmortagne> any idea why last watchlist mail is in russian ?  
09:09 <vmassol> I've noticed that too, no idea  
09:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: we were discussing the RC1 release with mflorea earlier.  
09:09 <vmassol> do we have a blocking or can we release?  
09:09 <+tmortagne> yep seen that  
09:09 <vmassol> \*blocker  
09:09 <vmassol> I remember denis raised an issue Friday  
09:09 <vmassol> but I don't know the status on it  
09:10 <+tmortagne> Denis found an important issue with Tomcat that I have on my xwiki-debug-eclipse setup too which make XWiki unusable  
09:10 <+tmortagne> but it's a very weird issue  
09:10 <vmassol> have we been able to track what commit introduced it?  
09:10 <+tmortagne> I tough is was caused by Eclipse si I did not digged much but  since Denis have the same issue...  
09:11 <+tmortagne> not really  
09:11 <+tmortagne> can't even tell what is the issue  
09:11 <vmassol> ok is that something you could look at today?  
09:11 <+tmortagne> looks like a tomcat internal multithread issue from what I seen  
09:12 <vmassol> the other blocker we have are functional tests. Some of us need to work on fixing them today. I can help. I'd need help from others too  
09:12 <vmassol> any other known blocker?  
09:14 <+tmortagne> I would like to finish XWIKI-7384, there is not much left to do (mark an imported extension as imported to display an "update" button, match extension authors with existing users the wiki and make the download button usable with this kind of extensions)  
09:16 <vmassol> the release date for RC1 was 12th of Jan. We're the 16th… IMO we need to release ASAP. We should put ourselves in release mode: fix failing tests, fix blocking issues  
09:16 <vmassol> ASAP = tomorow probably  
09:16 <vmassol> we need the time to fix blocker + tests  
09:20 <+tmortagne> sure  
09:21 <+tmortagne> but the tomcat issue seems to be a tricky one, can't promise anything for tomorow  
09:21 <+tmortagne> but it's a blocker for sure  
09:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <+tmortagne> mflorea, vmassol: XWIKI-7400  
09:37 <vmassol> ok  
09:37 <vmassol> setting fix for  
09:48 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <vmassol> trying to find why http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News doesn't have the AS anymore  
09:55 <vmassol> really weird… the content has the AS macro  
09:55 <vmassol> if I change the content to just {{activity entries="50" wikis="xwiki,platform,enterprise,manager,extensions,dev,xeclipse,xoffice,contrib,commons,rendering"/}} and preview it works fine  
09:56 <vmassol> actually even without changing the content, just clicking preview works fine  
09:56 <vmassol> so it seems to be some view cache  
10:02 <vmassol> just checked, rendering cache is not enable in xwiki.properties  
10:03 <vmassol> bb in 10mn  
10:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <lucaa> has quit  
10:17 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <lucaa> has quit  
10:50 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r09d22c0 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/rest/WikisResourceTest.java : Fix failing test. - http://git.io/yzEaKw  
10:53 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* r1d39e75 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-test/src/main/java/org/xwiki/test/integration/XWikiTestSetup.java : XE-1088: Ensure that functional tests don't go out on the internet when going to the Extension Manager UI pages ...  
10:57 <vmassol> nope didn't work...  
11:05 <xipe\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <xipe\_> has quit  
11:09 <+mflorea> vmassol: do we take screenshots when a selenium 2 test fails? I don't find any image in the target dir, so I suppose we don't.  
11:11 <CIA-121> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) master \* r150baea / (3 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7387: Small improvements on the search page UI (alignment, borders, etc.) ...  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> I want to call a wiki page on a scheduler task, so I put the code "xwiki.getDocument("AeliaCode.GetNewKPIs").getRenderedContent();"  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> but it doesn't work  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> what is wrong?  
11:39 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rcd25706 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/appwithinminutes/ClassEditorTest.java : Debugging test failure on CI by taking a screenshot. - http://git.io/W-4ogw  
12:21 <CIA-121> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) master \* r7df6e6b / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/icons/xwiki/pagination-controls.png : XWIKI-6982: Icon background bug on non-white page background ...  
12:28 <vmassol> mflorea: we do take screenshots  
12:29 <vmassol> if you check a failing test you'll see that it indicates the directory where the image is located  
12:31 <vmassol> we take screenshots in XWikiWrappingDriver  
12:31 <vmassol> which is wrapping the webdriver dirver  
12:31 <vmassol> \*driver  
12:31 <vmassol> we take screenshots when an element fails to be found there  
12:32 <vmassol> we also take screenshots in waitUntilCondition  
12:32 <vmassol> (TestUtils.waitUntilCondition)  
12:57 <lucaa> has quit  
12:58 <mflorea> has quit  
13:12 <CIA-121> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) master \* r6af285e / (3 files): XWIKI-7402: Replace white background icons with their transparent version ...  
13:12 <CIA-121> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) master \* rbe23f54 / (2 files): XWIKI-7402: Replace white background icons with their transparent version ...  
13:36 <vmassol> something we should use: http://www.google.com/webfonts ?  
13:44 <vmassol> has quit  
13:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:46 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/891/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/ClassEditorTest/testFieldNameAutoGeneration/ is the last failing test apparently. It has a sceenshot generated  
13:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you remember if sergiu has updated http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/ after the EM UI he's introduced in 3.3?  
13:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:52 <+tmortagne> vmassol: no it's still not updated AFAIK  
13:52 <vmassol> ok we need to ping sergiu about it when he's online  
13:52 <vmassol> it's been going on for too long  
13:52 <+tmortagne> yep  
13:53 <+tmortagne> he has a jira issue assigned to himself already  
13:53 <vmassol> ah let me comment there but we should still ping him about it  
13:53 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-1062  
13:56 <vmassol> my internet connection is misbehaving  
13:56 <vmassol> (fyi just in case I drop again)  
13:59 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is only one EM test, I broke http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/263/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.repository/RepositoryTest/testAddExtension/ yesterday I think, i'm looking at it  
13:59 <+tmortagne> this one is about XR  
14:01 <vmassol> ok  
14:01 <+tmortagne> not yesterday but saturday actually  
14:01 <vmassol> (I put EM and XR together)  
14:09 <vmassol> anyone has any idea why http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News isn't displaying the AS? (I'm stumped on this one… :))  
14:14 <+mflorea> ping  
14:14 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/891/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/ClassEditorTest/testFieldNameAutoGeneration/ is the last failing test apparently. It has a sceenshot generated  
14:14 <vmassol> btw to reproduce a flickering you can use @Intermitting annotation  
14:15 <vmassol> it'll repeat the same test 100 times  
14:15 <vmassol> I use that often to find flickering issues  
14:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: I've seen the screenshot  
14:16 <vmassol> ok  
14:16 <vmassol> does it help? :)  
14:16 <+mflorea> not much, it shows what I was already suspecting  
14:18 <+mflorea> the problem is the drag&drop from Selenium which is not very reliable. I don't understand why it works for the rest of the tests and it fails for this one. Anyway, I'm still investigating. Btw, it always passes locally, so there's something different on CI  
14:18 <vmassol> CI is using a different version of FF  
14:19 <vmassol> we should ugrade the FF versions btw, except for one which we need to keep in 3.6  
14:19 <+mflorea> nop, I upgraded agent-2 to FF 9.0.1  
14:19 <+mflorea> and the ui tests are run on agent-2  
14:19 <vmassol> ah ok, would be good that we update agent names or something to know where we stand  
14:19 <+mflorea> indeed  
14:20 <vmassol> @mflorea: does it pass 100% of times with the @Intermittent anno locally? (ie 100 times)  
14:21 <vmassol> sometimes I had to run 300 times before I found an issue  
14:21 <vmassol> it could be caused by the speed of the machine  
14:21 <+mflorea> let me check, but the fact that is failed for 83 continous builds on CI tells me that it isn't a flicker  
14:21 <vmassol> yep :)  
14:22 <CIA-121> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) master \* rba830e2 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-colibri/src/main/resources/colibri/ie-all.css : XWIKI-7390: Pencil button not visible when changing profile image ...  
14:25 <+sburjan> evalica: I think you are putting the wrong commit numbers in the jira issues when closing.  
14:27 <+evalica> sburjan:  why do you say that?  
14:29 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you can look at autowatch, you probably want to skip exactly the same groups  
14:32 <vmassol> would be nice to have a read only option in the admin  
14:32 <vmassol> (to make a subwiki read only)  
14:34 <+tmortagne> did something changed around REST ? looks like it's impossible to return a custom java object in a REST resource now  
14:34 <+tmortagne> that's what makes http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/263/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.repository/RepositoryTest/testAddExtension/ failing  
14:35 <+tmortagne> or maybe it's on my side only this particular issue  
14:36 <+tmortagne> lets try to commit the bug I found, will see if it's working on jenkins  
14:37 <vmassol> hmm I removed the registration right on playgroundtemplate subwiki but I still see the register button when logged out....  
14:37 <vmassol> oh my bad  
14:37 <vmassol> fixing  
14:38 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r6e3bb2c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/xwiki/internal/resources/AbstractExtensionRESTResource.java : XWIKI-7384: Provide UI to import and synchronize an external extension ...  
14:55 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r9930e0a / (2 files in 2 dirs): Make sure the addField method doesn't fail silently. ...  
15:02 <CIA-121> Eduard Moraru master \* r4934d92 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/macros.vm : XWIKI-7361: #resizedUserAvatar macro displays noavatar.png instead of actual user avatar in inline mode. - http://git.io/bEQ5UA  
15:02 <CIA-121> Eduard Moraru master \* r1f303cc / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-template-features/src/main/resources/Panels/WorkspaceInformationPanel.xml : - Fixed leftover bug from the conversion to 2.1 syntax of the workspace information panel. - http://git.io/DXuMXw  
15:02 <CIA-121> Eduard Moraru stable-3.3.x \* r3d75ed9 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/macros.vm : XWIKI-7361: #resizedUserAvatar macro displays noavatar.png instead of actual user avatar in inline mode. ...  
15:02 <CIA-121> Eduard Moraru stable-3.3.x \* r6e633bc / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-template-features/src/main/resources/Panels/WorkspaceInformationPanel.xml : - Fixed leftover bug from the conversion to 2.1 syntax of the workspace information panel. ...  
15:18 <vmassol> mflorea: maybe we could upgrade the selenium version we use : see http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-1078  
15:18 <+mflorea> sure, I can do it  
15:19 <vmassol> I remember I tried to do it a while ago and there were some new tests failing (if I remember correctly)  
15:19 <vmassol> but we have to bit the bullet at some point  
15:19 <vmassol> and they've released a 2.1.6.1  
15:19 <+mflorea> yep  
15:19 <vmassol> 2.16.1  
15:19 <+mflorea> ok, I'll upgrade and investigate the failing tests  
15:19 <vmassol> ok I can help too  
15:20 <vmassol> "Native events enabled for Firefox 9"  
15:20 <vmassol> that could be interesting  
15:20 <+sburjan> yes  
15:20 <+mflorea> re this, I'm upgrading all agents that are using FF 6.0 to 9.0.1  
15:21 <vmassol> ok , make sure you keep one on 3.6  
15:21 <+mflorea> ok  
15:21 <vmassol> since we're officially supporting 3.6  
15:27 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <+mflorea> vmassol: all agents were using FF 6.0. Do you have any preference regarding which to use FF 3.6?  
15:33 <vmassol> no pref  
15:34 <+mflorea> now, I see that tests are bound to some agents  
15:34 <+mflorea> for instance, ui-tests run on agent-1 or 2  
15:34 <vmassol> hmmm  
15:34 <vmassol> I don't think we should do that  
15:34 <vmassol> actually I was pretty sure I had removed this at some point  
15:34 <vmassol> so someone must have put it back  
15:34 <+mflorea> so even if I setup FF 3.6 on agent-5, it doesn't mean the test will run on FF3.6  
15:35 <+tmortagne> the issue is that ui test don't work on other agents  
15:35 <vmassol> so that's what we should fix I guess  
15:36 <+tmortagne> agennt-3 still have lots of sigfault and agent-4 to 6 were always faling to start XWiki last time  
15:36 <+mflorea> I'll setup FF3.6 on agent-1, this way it's 50% change to run on FF3.6 and on latest FF, 9.0.1  
15:42 <+sburjan> evalica: when using the Dusk Theme, I can't see/hardly see which of the bottom tabs are selected. Other Themes change the text color of the selected tab, but dusk doesn't. Should I create a JIRA for this ?  
15:46 <+sburjan> creating improvement on JIRA  
15:46 <+evalica> sburjan: no you shouldn't create one.  
15:46 <+sburjan> ok  
15:46 <+evalica> the differenciator is the background too  
15:47 <+sburjan> yes, but that's extremely hard to see IMO  
15:47 <+evalica> depends on the lighting of your screen - we don't have a rule on a specific color for that zone  
15:47 <+sburjan> well the other themes change text color  
15:47 <+sburjan> so this makes dusk a little bit inconsistent  
15:48 <+evalica> well Dusk also changes the color of the global menu - they shouldn't be 1-1 simmetric  
15:48 <+sburjan> ok, you know better  
15:48 <+evalica> k thanks for reporting  
15:53 <+tmortagne> note: found the issue with XWIKI-7400, currently fixing it  
15:53 <vmassol> great!  
15:53 <+tmortagne> it's several issues actually  
15:53 <+tmortagne> but the main one is XCOMMONS-77  
15:54 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r40f91f9 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Improve my previous commit (make sure addField doesn't fail silently). - http://git.io/QMxUjg  
15:54 <+tmortagne> so the init is done with a stub context and here come the second issue: the stub context use the same response instance in all its instances  
15:54 <vmassol> would anyone know why we get this invalid menu entry when the Office app isn't present: http://playgroundtemplate.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/AdminSheet ?  
15:55 <vmassol> (I don't get it locally so maybe something was fixed on 3.4? Otherwise it means it's caused by multiwiki setup)  
15:55 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think sdumitriu fixed something like that recently  
15:56 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-7397  
15:56 <vmassol> seems like it  
15:56 <+tmortagne> yep this one  
15:56 <vmassol> thanks  
15:59 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r21c0c88 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-context/src/main/java/org/xwiki/context/internal/DefaultExecutionContextManager.java : XCOMMONS-77: XWikiContext is set after ExecutionContext initialization ...  
15:59 <CIA-121> tmortagne stable-3.3.x \* r07f1df7 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-context/src/main/java/org/xwiki/context/internal/DefaultExecutionContextManager.java : XCOMMONS-77: XWikiContext is set after ExecutionContext initialization ...  
16:24 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r78a5f5a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/DefaultXWikiStubContextProvider.java : XWIKI-7400: Unusable on tomcat in some condition ...  
16:32 <vmassol> mflorea: the new sheet system has broken this page on xwiki.org: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News  
16:32 <vmassol> I'm looking for a way to fix it  
16:32 <vmassol> what we had before:  
16:32 <vmassol> - there's a Blog object on that page  
16:33 <vmassol> - the Blog.Blogsheet was using that page's Blog object to display blog entries  
16:33 <vmassol> what's happening now:  
16:33 <vmassol> - the new sheet system uses the Blogsheet associated with teh Blog object to render it  
16:34 <vmassol> so basically I need to control the display of the page myself  
16:34 <vmassol> myself = in the News page  
16:37 <+mflorea> let me look at it  
16:38 <vmassol> btw this has stumped me for more than half a day today  
16:38 <vmassol> which proves without doubt that the new sheet system although being powerful is also very very magical  
16:38 <vmassol> :)  
16:38 <vmassol> (I spent several hours on this)
